title: Mejais and SOTO too easy for higher ranked/more experienced players to abuse in lower elos?
body: the amount of times I've had my skull crushed by a smurf who can exploit new player's lack of knowledge of the game, pick up a stacking item and just go to town catching out your team members who don't know how to ward or watch the map yet makes some rare games way too hard to turn around and ultimately hopeless. I mean sure the items are really risky choices but sometimes you just get matched with people who are very new to the game or have a very hard time picking it up and there's only so much you can do to try prevent them from giving up more kills all whilst trying to keep yourself safe from the 20stack soto and mejais diamond 1 Evelyn that is probably in your jungle waiting to 1-shot you if you even think about trying to take raptors. Yeah, not fun.

replies.body:
That problem lies in smurfing existing at all, not SoTO and Mejai's. They exist for making snowballing easier and giving experienced players an easier way to climb if they feel everyone around them is a low MMR noob.

Smurfing, on the other hand, is made to make sure everyone around the player is a noob when that's specifically what you should avoid. At least some of them have the dignity and respect to end games quickly instead of not pushing to get 50 kills, see how much they can get Baron in one game and to further humiliate the other 9 people

So a noob or a few noobs are letting you down?

Good, why would you want to carry these noobs.

Move on.
Because my LP in on the line and I lose more from a loss than I gain from a victory.
